docs.title: index
docs.text: linux guide

docs.title: 001-bash-loop
docs.text: You can use a for loop with ls in Bash to iterate over files or directories listed by the ls command. Here's how you can do it:

docs.title: Example 1: Loop through files in the current directory
docs.text:
for file in $(ls)
do
    echo "File: $file"
done

This loop uses ls to get the list of files in the current directory and iterates over each file, printing its name.

docs.title: Example 2: Loop through files with a specific extension
docs.text:
If you want to loop through only files with a specific extension, you can modify the ls command like this:

for file in $(ls *.txt)
do
    echo "Text File: $file"
done

This will only loop through .txt files in the current directory.

docs.title: Example 3: Using for with ls and find for nested directories
docs.text:
If you need to loop through files in subdirectories, you can use find in combination with a for loop:

for file in $(find . -type f)
do
    echo "File: $file"
done

This will recursively find all files starting from the current directory (.) and print each file name.

docs.title: Example 4: Loop through files in a directory and handle spaces in filenames
docs.text:
Using $(ls) can cause issues if filenames contain spaces or special characters. A safer way is to use a for loop with find or glob pattern matching directly:

for file in *  # Match all files in the current directory
do
    echo "File: $file"
done

This will handle filenames with spaces correctly.

docs.title: Example 5: Using ls with -1 option for a line-by-line output
docs.text:
Using ls -1 (note the -1 flag) lists files one per line, and you can loop through them like this:

for file in $(ls -1)
do
    echo "File: $file"
done

Let me know if you'd like more examples or explanations!

docs.title: 002-bash-while-loop
docs.text: A while loop in Bash can be used to read input from stdin (standard input), often using the read command inside the loop. This allows you to process user input or pipe data into the loop.

docs.title: Example 1: Simple while loop to read from stdin
docs.text:
This loop reads each line of input until the end of the input (e.g., when the user presses Ctrl+D to signal the end of input).

while IFS= read -r line
do
    echo "You entered: $line"
done

Explanation: - IFS= read -r line: This reads a line from stdin, storing it in the variable line. The IFS (Internal Field Separator) is set to nothing to preserve leading and trailing spaces. The -r option ensures backslashes are not treated as escape characters. - The loop continues until the user ends the input (by pressing Ctrl+D or when the input stream ends).

docs.title: Example 2: Reading user input interactively
docs.text:
You can also use this in an interactive script, where the user is prompted for input:

echo "Enter something (Ctrl+D to quit):"
while IFS= read -r line
do
    echo "You entered: $line"
done

docs.title: Example 3: Reading from stdin with a condition
docs.text:
If you want to stop reading input based on a condition (e.g., the user types "exit"), you can use a conditional statement inside the loop:

echo "Enter some text (type 'exit' to quit):"
while IFS= read -r line
do
    if [ "$line" == "exit" ]; then
        echo "Exiting..."
        break
    fi
    echo "You entered: $line"
done

docs.title: Example 4: Piping data into a while loop
docs.text:
You can also pipe data into a while loop. For example, let's use echo to send multiple lines of text into the loop:

echo -e "Line 1\nLine 2\nLine 3" | while IFS= read -r line
do
    echo "Read from pipe: $line"
done

Output: 

Read from pipe: Line 1
Read from pipe: Line 2
Read from pipe: Line 3

docs.title: Example 5: Reading input and processing each line with a command
docs.text:
You can read lines of input and process them using a command or script. Here's an example where we read each line and count the number of words in each line:

echo "Enter some text (Ctrl+D to quit):"
while IFS= read -r line
do
    word_count=$(echo "$line" | wc -w)
    echo "Word count: $word_count"
done

This will output the number of words for each line entered by the user.

Let me know if you need more examples or a specific case!

docs.title: netplan dhcp
docs.text:
echo "
network:
  ethernets:
    eth0:
      dhcp4: true
  version: 2
" | sudo tee /etc/netplan/00-installer-config.yaml

docs.title: netplan static ip
docs.text:
echo "
network:
  ethernets:
    eth0:
      addresses:
        - 192.168.1.11/24
      gateway4: 192.168.1.1
      nameservers:
        addresses: [192.168.1.1]
  version: 2
" | sudo tee /etc/netplan/00-installer-config.yaml

docs.title: netplan wifi
docs.text:
network:
  version: 2
  wifis:
    wlp2s0:
      access-points:
        wifi-ssid:
          password: passw0rd
      dhcp4: true

docs.title: netplan wifi
docs.text:
network:
  version: 2
  wifis:
    wlp2s0:
      access-points:
        wifi-ssid:
          password: passw0rd
      dhcp4: false
      addresses:
        - 192.168.1.12/24
      routes:
        - to: default
          via: 192.168.1.1
      nameservers:
        addresses: [192.168.1.1]

multiplue network config 

      routes:
        - to: 192.168.1.0/24
          via: 192.168.1.1

docs.title: fstab
docs.text:
# <file system> <mount point>   <type>  <options>       <dump>  <pass>
# / was on /dev/nvme0n1p4 during curtin installation
/dev/disk/by-uuid/xxxx / ext4 defaults 0 1
# /boot/efi was on /dev/nvme0n1p1 during curtin installation
/dev/disk/by-uuid/xxxxxx /boot/efi vfat defaults 0 1
/dev/disk/by-uuid/xxxxxx none swap sw 0 0
/dev/disk/by-uuid/xxxx /mnt/data ntfs-3g defaults,uid=1000,gid=1000 0 0

docs.text: $ ls -l /dev/disk/by-uuid/

docs.title: firewall
docs.text:
# allow ssh port
sudo ufw status numbered
sudo ufw enable
sudo ufw allow 22
sudo ufw allow 2222

# ?
sudo ufw insert 1 allow 80


# delete port
sudo ufw status numbered
sudo ufw delete 1


# Allow Incoming from Specific IP Address or Subnet
sudo ufw allow from 192.168.1.0/24 to any port 22
sudo ufw allow from 192.168.1.0/24 to 192.168.1.48 port 80


# 特定の接続元＆ポートに対して許可　★この記事のケースでは、一番よく使うと思います
ufw allow from [IP] to any port [port]
sudo ufw allow from 192.168.1.0/24 to any port ssh

docs.title: 特定のIPアドレスからの接続を許可する
docs.text:
# local
sudo ufw allow from 192.168.1.0/24
# docker 
sudo ufw allow from 172.0.0.0/8

sudo ufw allow from 127.0.0.1/24
sudo ufw allow from localhost

docs.title: startup service
docs.text:
# add service
sudo cp /opt1/linux-auto-startup/init.d/linux-auto-startup /etc/init.d/linux-auto-startup
sudo chmod +x /etc/init.d/linux-auto-startup
cd /etc/init.d/
sudo update-rc.d linux-auto-startup defaults 90
vim /opt1/linux-auto-startup/startup.sh

# remove service
sudo update-rc.d -f linux-auto-startup remove

# start service
sudo /etc/init.d/linux-auto-startup start

sudo vim sudo /etc/init.d/linux-auto-startup
sudo /etc/init.d/linux-auto-startup start

docs.text:
https://docs.docker.com/engine/install/ubuntu/

sudo install -m 0755 -d /etc/apt/keyrings
curl -fsSL https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu/gpg | sudo gpg --dearmor -o /etc/apt/keyrings/docker.gpg
sudo chmod a+r /etc/apt/keyrings/docker.gpg

echo \
  "deb [arch="$(dpkg --print-architecture)" signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/docker.gpg] https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu \
  "$(. /etc/os-release && echo "$VERSION_CODENAME")" stable" | \
  sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/docker.list > /dev/null

docs.title: docker replace
docs.text:
• Rancher（ランチャー）は、コンテナ管理の効率化を目的としたオープンソースソフトウェア（OSS）です。Kubernetes環境の運用管理や、複数のKubernetesクラスターの管理を可能にします。
  • Podman（ポッドマン）は、コンテナの開発・管理・実行を可能にするオープンソースのツールです。Red Hat 社のエンジニアとオープンソースコミュニティによって開発されました。

docs.title: 203-android-sdkmanager
docs.text: 要通过命令行使用 sdkmanager 安装 Android SDK 组件（如平台、构建工具和系统镜像），你需要先安装 Android Command Line Tools 并正确设置环境变量。下面是详细的步骤：

docs.title: 1. 安装 Android Command Line Tools
docs.text:
1. 下载 Android Command Line Tools：
  2. 访问 Android Studio 下载页面。

  3. 在页面中找到 Command Line Tools，根据你的操作系统选择下载：

    • Windows: 下载 commandlinetools-win-xxxx.zip
    • macOS: 下载 commandlinetools-mac-xxxx.zip
    • Linux: 下载 commandlinetools-linux-xxxx.zip

  4. 解压缩并安装： 将下载的压缩文件解压到你希望安装 Android SDK 的目录中。 例如，在 Windows 上，解压到 C:\android-sdk，在 macOS/Linux 上，可以解压到 ~/android-sdk。

解压后，应该会有一个 cmdline-tools 目录，里面包含了 sdkmanager 和其他工具。

docs.title: 2. 设置环境变量
docs.text: 确保 ANDROID_HOME 和 PATH 环境变量已正确设置，以便你可以从命令行访问 Android SDK 工具。

docs.title: Windows 设置：
docs.text:
1. 打开“系统属性”并选择“环境变量”。
  2. 在“系统变量”部分，点击“新建”来设置 ANDROID_HOME，并将它指向你解压的 SDK 目录。例如： 
    ANDROID_HOME = C:\android-sdk
  3. 编辑 Path 环境变量，添加以下内容： 
    C:\android-sdk\cmdline-tools\latest\bin
C:\android-sdk\platform-tools

docs.title: macOS/Linux 设置：
docs.text:
1. 打开终端并编辑你的 shell 配置文件： 

    nano ~/.bash_profile   # 对于 bash
    或者： 
    nano ~/.zshrc           # 对于 zsh

  2. 在文件中添加以下内容： 

    export ANDROID_HOME=~/android-sdk
export PATH=$PATH:$ANDROID_HOME/cmdline-tools/latest/bin:$ANDROID_HOME/platform-tools

  3. 保存文件并运行： 

    source ~/.bash_profile   # 对于 bash
    或： 
    source ~/.zshrc          # 对于 zsh

docs.title: 3. 使用 sdkmanager 安装组件
docs.text: 在设置好环境变量后，打开终端（或命令提示符），并使用 sdkmanager 命令来安装 Android SDK 组件。

docs.title: 更新 SDK Manager：
docs.text:
首先，确保 sdkmanager 是最新版本，运行： 

sdkmanager --update

docs.title: 列出可用组件：
docs.text:
你可以查看所有可用的组件，包括平台、工具和系统映像，使用： 

sdkmanager --list

docs.title: 安装平台工具：
docs.text:
例如，安装最新的 Android 平台工具： 

sdkmanager "platform-tools"

docs.title: 安装构建工具：
docs.text:
例如，安装 Android 构建工具版本 30.0.3： 

sdkmanager "build-tools;30.0.3"

docs.title: 安装特定版本的 Android 平台：
docs.text:
安装特定版本的 Android 平台（如 Android 11）： 

sdkmanager "platforms;android-30"

docs.title: 安装系统映像（用于模拟器）：
docs.text:
安装系统映像（例如，Android 30 的 x86_64 架构）： 

sdkmanager "system-images;android-30;google_apis;x86_64"

docs.title: 安装 Android 模拟器：
docs.text:
如果你需要安装 Android 模拟器，可以运行： 

sdkmanager "emulator"

docs.title: 安装 Android API 级别：
docs.text:
如果你想安装 Android 29（API 29）及其构建工具，可以执行： 

sdkmanager "platforms;android-29"

docs.title: 安装所有更新：
docs.text:
如果你想要安装所有更新的 SDK 组件，运行： 

sdkmanager --licenses  # 同意许可证
sdkmanager --update    # 更新所有可用组件

docs.title: 4. 验证安装
docs.text:
安装完成后，你可以使用以下命令检查 Android SDK 是否正确安装和配置：

  • 查看设备是否连接： 

    adb devices

  • 查看已安装的模拟器： 

    emulator -list-avds

docs.title: 5. 安装其他组件（可选）
docs.text:
你可以通过 sdkmanager 安装更多 Android 工具和库，以下是一些常用的命令：

  • 安装 Google Play 服务： 

    sdkmanager "extras;google;google_play_services"

  • 安装支持的 Android 版本： 

    sdkmanager "platforms;android-28"

  • 安装 Java 仓库： 

    sdkmanager "extras;android;m2repository"

docs.title: 总结
docs.text: 通过 sdkmanager 命令，你可以方便地安装和管理 Android SDK 组件。记得在安装之前设置好 Android SDK 的环境变量，并确保使用最新的命令行工具。通过这些工具，你可以轻松管理 Android 平台、构建工具、模拟器和其他必需的组件。如果你在执行命令时遇到问题，随时告诉我，我会帮你进一步排查。
